intro: Cyrtandra × glabriflora, commonly known as the hybrid beautyberry, is a flowering plant in the family Gesneriaceae. It is a hybrid species resulting from the cross between Cyrtandra pedunculata and Cyrtandra glabriflora, combining traits from both parent species. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences that produce small, fleshy berries. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as tropical forests. Its botanical features make it a popular subject in horticulture and botanical research.
